p: Saponins are bioorganic compounds that exhibit triterpenoid or steroidal skeletons that are glycosylated by varying numbers of sugar moieties attached at different positions. Steroidal saponins are further classified into spirostanol, furostanol and open-chain steroidal saponins [ 46]. Saponins exhibit a wide range of biological properties, including hemolytic factor sand anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, insecticidal, anticancer and molluscicidal activities [ 47].
